Most cars are designed to express styles.  Some drivers prefer bold paints colors, regardless of the money they will pay in addition to the cost of the vehicle. While some like to cruise around in bouncy like off-roaders, which may not set feet of the track.

It a car's functions should be in line with its form this is the case with supercars designed in aggressive ways. However, in some cases, shapes is the primary aspect.

A BMW i8 cruising down the road will catch an eye. BMW i8 is the 'sharp-edged new roadster model' designed for ultimate road enjoyment. From the conceptual level to the actual design, BMW i8 had little modifications in the exterior design.

 

0-60 mph and Engine specifications

Quite surprising, the BMW i8, records below-par performance, it races from 0 to 60 slower than you would hope with regards to its type of car. It achieves 60 mph in 6.2 seconds, an output compared to 2015 WRX (SII made the 60 mph in six seconds).

However, it performs an impressive quarter mile, just like other WRX models of the fourth generation.

The brakes are quite impressive, offering consistent and reliable stop from 60-0 mph needing a 113-feet long line.

 

Engine specifications

For a combined output of 357 horsepower and 420 lb-ft of torque, the BMX i8 is powered by a 1.5-liter turbo-three paired with two electric motors. The only transmission available is a six-speed automatic.

 

The figures in the power area are not what is expected in supercars world, the sporty look of i8 is deceitful.

Unlike its rivals, the BMW i8 is not as quick as expected, but the machine reacts to throttle inputs with an encouraging acceleration that is sustainable, which will be a plus and thrilling adventure to speed hunters.

In the test review, BMW i8 achieved 60mph in just 4.4 seconds and reached the quarter mile at 110 mph in 12.9 seconds.

Although the figures do look impressive, it is not good enough when compared to other competitors in this category like Acura NSX hybrid, Porsche 911 Turbo and the elegant McLaren 570S.

 

The Exterior and Interior designs

The exterior design of i8 stands out, with lovely designs like the flying buttresses, doors that open upwards, the rear air ducts. The interior is worth the pay as well, with all digital cluster gauge; iDrive infotainment system with a freestanding screen, the door comes with angular grab handles and a wave-like design of the dash.

 

The Verdict

The BMW i8 is exotic in all ramifications, with a unique look powertrain with a plug-in hybrid, and dominant performance. As a hybrid toy, the BMW i8 can cruise on the electric power alone up to 15 miles based on EPA review.
